Description: Glass bowl; semi-transparent light green; mould-blown; flat base with pontil scar, sloping walls, lightly folded over rim; slightly lopsided; decorated with an eight-petalled flower and dots on the base and a diaper pattern on the sides.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, Said to have been found together with 1887,1121.1-10.
Bibliographic references: Lamm 1929-1930 / Mittelalterliche Gläser und Steinschnittarbeiten aus dem Nahen Osten (pl.12.17)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
Acquisition notes: Nineteenth century paper label on underside gives letters E.T.R. and the Franks monogram.
